title: Nuñomoral
text:
Nuñomoral is the head village of a municipality of the same name located in the center of the "comarca" of <a href="Las%20Hurdes">Las Hurdes</a>, <a href="province%20of%20C%C3%A1ceres">province of Cáceres</a>, <a href="Extremadura">Extremadura</a>, Spain. According to the 2006 <a href="census">census</a> (<a href="Instituto%20Nacional%20de%20Estad%C3%ADstica%20%28Spain%29">INE</a>), the municipality has a population of 1,494 inhabitants. The <a href="Hurdano%20River">Hurdano River</a> flows through the area.
Alquerías.
The following "alquerías" (small settlements of a few houses) are within the municipal limits of Nuñomoral (traditional variants of the name are in brackets):
History.
The church of Nuestra Sra. de la Asunción, built in masonry, is one of the few historical buildings in the area. In Asegur there are still some local houses with the traditional <a href="shale">shale</a> roof.
In former times the village of <a href="Ladrillar">Ladrillar</a> located to the north was part of the Nuñomoral area.
